definitions.example: He was in trouble when the rain started.

definitions.definition: A difficulty, problem, condition, or action contributing to such a situation.
definitions.example: The trouble was a leaking brake line.   The trouble with that suggestion is that we lack the funds to put it in motion.   The bridge column magnified the trouble with a slight tilt in the wrong direction.

definitions.definition: Efforts taken or expended, typically beyond the normal required.
definitions.example: It's no trouble for me to edit it.
He's been in hospital with some heart trouble.   My old car has engine trouble.

definitions.definition: Liability to punishment; conflict with authority.
definitions.example: He had some trouble with the law.

definitions.definition: A fault or interruption in a stratum.
To disturb, stir up, agitate (a medium, especially water).
To mentally distress; to cause (someone) to be anxious or perplexed.
definitions.example: What she said about narcissism is troubling me.

definitions.definition: In weaker sense: to bother or inconvenience.
definitions.example: I will not trouble you to deliver the letter.

definitions.definition: To take pains to do something.
definitions.example: I won't trouble to post the letter today; I can do it tomorrow.
